title: 64th Infantry Division (Wehrmacht)
text:
The 64th Infantry Division "(64. Infanterie-Division)" was a infantry <a href="Division%20%28military%29">division</a> of the <a href="Wehrmacht">Wehrmacht</a> during <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>.
History.
The division was formed sometime before August 1944 in <a href="Cologne">Cologne</a>. It saw action at <a href="Battle%20of%20Abbeville">Battle of Abbeville</a> and was isolated when the <a href="15th%20Army%20%28Wehrmacht%29">15th Army</a> left by <a href="Scheldt">Scheldt</a>. Because of the division's commander, Major General Knut Eberding, to stay behind and fight the <a href="2nd%20Canadian%20Corps">2nd Canadian Corps</a> resulting in the <a href="Breskens%20Pocket">Breskens Pocket</a>. Because of the battle the main army was able to organize the <a href="Ardennes%20Offensive">Ardennes Offensive</a>.
Organization.
